title: Clear Your Workspace, Clear Your Mind: Retreat to the Mountains
subtitle: Environment is everything.
section1_heading: Why Is My Workspace Such a Mess?
section1_content: Because environment is everything. You’re sitting there, staring at the clutter on your desk, the noise around you, the endless little distractions that keep pulling your attention away from the work you need to do. Your workspace isn’t just messy—it’s actively blocking you from doing what matters most. You’re not alone in this frustration. As a builder—whether you’re creating code, writing the next chapter, composing music, or designing the next big thing—your environment is your foundation. When it’s chaotic, cluttered, or full of distractions, it’s not just inconvenient. It’s destructive. The messy workspace isn’t just about physical clutter—it’s a symptom of a deeper problem: your environment isn’t working for you.
section2_content: Your mind craves clarity. When your environment is chaotic, so are your thoughts. That stack of papers, the constant notifications, the noise bleeding in from the outside world—it’s all piling up in your head, too. It’s no wonder you feel stuck, frustrated, and unproductive. But here’s the truth: you don’t have to keep pushing through the noise. You don’t have to force focus in a space that’s working against you. When you step into a clean, intentional, supportive environment, everything shifts. The clutter disappears, your mind clears, and your work finally starts to flow.
section3_content: As ambitious, independent thinkers, builders like you don’t want anyone telling you how to create. But here’s the thing: your workspace is already doing that. The distractions, the interruptions, the lack of space to breathe—it’s all dictating how much you can accomplish. You don’t need a better to-do list or a new productivity hack. You need a space that supports your creativity, focus, and vision. A space that strips away everything unnecessary and amplifies what’s most important.
section4_heading: Why a Cabin in the Mountains?
section4_content: There’s something magical about stepping into a cabin surrounded by the stillness of the mountains. The air is crisp and clean, uncluttered by the weight of daily life. The quiet is so profound that you can finally hear your own thoughts again. The simplicity of the space reminds you of what truly matters, while the beauty of the landscape sparks inspiration. This isn’t just a break. It’s a reset. In the mountains, distractions fall away. The clutter you’ve been battling—both physical and mental—disappears. You’re left with only what you need: your work, your ideas, and the clarity to bring them to life.
section5_content: Hi, I’m Craig. I’m a tech professional and an AirBnB superhost with over 300 5-star reviews. I know firsthand the importance of getting into a flow state—and how fragile that state can be when your environment is working against you. I’ve been where you are: stuck, frustrated, surrounded by a space that makes it impossible to focus. That’s why I created this retreat. I wanted to offer a space where ambitious builders like you—creatives, coders, writers, and makers—could finally step away from the noise and into an environment that works with you, not against you. This cabin isn’t just a place to stay. It’s a tool. A space designed to clear the clutter, spark inspiration, and help you do your best work.
section6_content: Your work deserves better than a messy workspace. You deserve better than a space that constantly pulls you away from your focus. Imagine what you could accomplish in a space that inspires you. A place where the only thing demanding your attention is the work that matters most. This is your chance to step into that space. To leave the noise behind and rediscover the clarity you’ve been searching for.
